message.content:
cs.AR, cs.OS, cs.DB, cs.SY, cs.DC

Reasoning: 
- cs.AR (Architecture): The paper proposes a new memory architecture that combines DRAM and PCM, and discusses the design choices and trade-offs involved. 
- cs.OS (Operating Systems): The paper leverages the OS virtual memory support to manage the migration of pages between DRAM and PCM, and proposes a new buffer to track recently-accessed pages. 
- cs.DB (Databases): The paper discusses the wear overhead of PCM and proposes a solution to reduce it by migrating pages to DRAM. This is relevant to database systems that use PCM as a storage medium. 
- cs.SY (Systems and Control): The paper proposes a system-level solution to improve the performance and energy efficiency of PCM-based memory systems. 
- cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing): The paper discusses the bandwidth overhead of PCM and proposes a solution to reduce it by migrating pages to DRAM. This is relevant to distributed and parallel computing systems that use PCM as a main memory technology.
